stories.title: Watch “How an Ising machine solves the traveling salesman problem” on YouTube

stories.text:
I'm looking for feedback from entrepreneurs who have moved on to something new after starting their own company or companies. I'm three companies deep and have decided I don't have another one in me at this point. I'm not interested in taking a CEO position elsewhere or pursuing the more "standard" path of becoming an investor.

My strength/passion is in identifying a need and building things people like. Not so much running the company once the thing exists and has been properly brought to market.

Are there roles inside larger organizations that cater to this skillset? Consulting is a pretty obvious path but I'm hoping there might be some out-of-the-box ideas from anyone who has made a similar transition.
stories.title: Ask HN: Work life after starting companies for entrepreneurs?
